item.label: Country of Origin or State of Birth

list.head: Background Information
list.item: Comments: Final Certificate is actually "Additional Entry Under Section 2306 of the Revised Statues of the United States," added to original homestead no. 2122 Legal Description E2 NW4 Sec 22, Town 96N, Range 27W of 80 acres at the Fort Dodge, Iowa, Land Office on 1869-05-18, which was canceled for abandonment 1870-03-26. File also contains 2 copies of Assignment of Assignee from Theo. F. Barnes to Edward P. Meyers. Also contains Record of examination of the records of the General Land Office by C. H. Moulton and Son Attorneys at Law, Affidavit by William E. Shileds that he served in the military under and by the name of William Edgars (Records of Military Service are in the Names of William Edgars), Proof of Assignment and Assignment by William E. Shields to Theo. F. Barnes, Special Affidavit by William E. Shields swearing that he sold his Additional Rights to Theo. F. Barnes, Assignment of Soldier's Additional Right by the original claimant William E. Shields, Affidavit by William E. Shileds that he is the identical person who served in the military as William Edgars, notice by the Department of Interior of re-survey affecting the boundaries of land owned by Edward P. Myers, including the land in this patent, 2 copies of Affidavit by Theo. F. Barnes that he, as owner of the rights of William E. Shields sold them to Edward P. Myers, another Affidavit by Theo. F. Barnes swearing that he sold the rights of William E. Shields in good faith and for a valuable consideration to Edward P. Meyers. Stamped on the final certificate is the following: "Patent to contain reservation according to proviso to the Act of Aug. 30, 1890."
